alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County; Northeastern Nye County; Northern Lander County and Northern Eureka County; Northwestern Nye County; South Central Elko County; Southeastern Elko County; Southern Lander County and Southern Eureka County; Southwest Elko County; White Pine County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 31 at 2:33AM PST by NWS Elko
info.description: ...SNOW SHOWERS THROUGH TODAY FOLLOWED BY COLD TEMPERATURES... Additional snow showers will continue today before winding down this evening. Many areas will see around an inch or less, though up to two inches are possible across some of the valleys in northeast and east-central Nevada. Mountainous locations are expected to receive two to four inches or more of new snow. Breezy winds today could lead to more blowing and drifting snow as well. While the holiday weekend looks to be on the dry side, confidence is high that much colder temperatures will be felt as highs will reach the the 20s to low 30s, with some upper teens possible Saturday. Nighttime lows expected to dip into the single digits to single digits below zero Friday and Saturday night, though some of the colder locales could see double digit below zero readings. Visit www.weather.gov/elko for the latest weather information.
